      • setCurrentStatementProcessorForDatabase

        public StatementProcessor setCurrentStatementProcessorForDatabase​(String databaseName)
                                                           throws BoltProtocolBreachFatality,
                                                                  BoltIOException
        We select the TransactionStateMachine based on the database name provided here. This transaction state machine will be kept in MutableConnectionState until the transaction is closed. When closing, the transaction state machine will perform a callback to releaseStatementProcessor() to release itself from MutableConnectionState.
        Specified by:
        setCurrentStatementProcessorForDatabase in interface StateMachineContext
        Parameters:
        databaseName -
        Throws:
        BoltProtocolBreachFatality
        BoltIOException

      • releaseStatementProcessor

        public void releaseStatementProcessor()
        This callback is expected to be invoked inside a TransactionStateMachine to release itself for GC when the transaction is closed. The reason that we have this callback is that the TransactionStateMachine has a better knowledge of when itself can be released.
        Specified by:
        releaseStatementProcessor in interface StatementProcessorReleaseManager

      • isCurrentStatementProcessorNotSet

        private boolean isCurrentStatementProcessorNotSet​(String databaseName)
                                           throws BoltProtocolBreachFatality
        Throws:
        BoltProtocolBreachFatality

      • setStatementProcessorProvider

        void setStatementProcessorProvider​(StatementProcessorProvider statementProcessorProvider)
